title: Josh McDaniels, Patriots QB coach setting the bar high for an improved Drake Maye in 2025
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' Josh McDaniels and Ashton Grant place high expectations on QB Drake Maye for the 2025 season.
Maye is tasked with more pre-snap responsibilities, showing growth in pre-snap reads under McDaniels' mentorship.
In 2024, Maye completed 66.6% of passes for 2,276 yards, but Patriots only won one game he started and finished.

title: More brands added to radioactive shrimp recall
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: The FDA expanded a nationwide recall of potentially radioactive shrimp brands sold in Massachusetts and nine other states.
Recalled brands include Southwind Foods, Sand Bar, Best Yet, Arctic Shores, Great American, and First Street.
Officials found radioactive Cesium-137 in shrimp shipped from Indonesia, posing long-term cancer risks with repeated exposure.

title: Photos released of suspect who allegedly blew up ATM in Woburn
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: FBI seeks masked suspect who allegedly used an explosive device at Eastern Bank ATM in Woburn, damaging the machine.
Photos released show suspect in a blue mask and dark shirt; incident occurred after reports of ATM tampering.
No injuries reported from the explosion; authorities advise anyone with information to contact Woburn Police or the FBI.

title: 10 bold predictions for the 2025 Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is crucial for the Patriots' playoff hopes, expected to achieve 30 total touchdowns this season.
TreVeyon Henderson, a rookie from Ohio State, is predicted to surpass 1,000 rushing yards and score 10 touchdowns.
Patriots projected to end 2025 season with an 8-9 record, missing the playoffs despite improvements and roster changes.

title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady nearly joined the Raiders as a quarterback in 2020 but instead signed with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Raiders owner Mark Davis recently confirmed the team's interest in Brady, who became a Raiders minority owner in 2023.
Brady's role as FOX's top NFL commentator has NFL-imposed restrictions due to his 10% ownership in the Raiders.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd is now streaming on HBO Max.
'Highest 2 Lowest', a Spike Lee film with Denzel Washington, is available on Apple TV+.
Disney's live-action 'Lilo & Stitch' is streaming on Disney+, after grossing over $1 billion.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers and Pete Carroll return to Foxborough as Raiders face Patriots without Bill Belichick for first time in 25 years.
Raiders head coach Pete Carroll emphasizes Patriots' strong running game and Drake Maye's scrambling ability in pre-game comments.
Jakobi Meyers expresses excitement about playing against former team but remains focused on the upcoming game despite trade rumors.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown and IShowSpeed recreated the Boston Tea Party, dumping tea into water during a live stream.
Brown challenged IShowSpeed to a race in Downtown Crossing, resulting in a narrow win for the YouTube streamer.
Jaylen Brown plans more streaming, having launched his Twitch channel, FCHWPO, after collaborating with streamers like Kyrie Irving.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell will make his NFL debut as the starting left tackle against the Raiders on Sunday.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's dynamic run blocking and competitive edge despite concerns over his arm length.
Campbell received high grades in both pass and run blocking during preseason, indicating strong potential as a franchise tackle.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel responds neutrally to Bill Belichick's ban on Patriots scouts at University of North Carolina.
Bill Belichick prevents Patriots scouts from accessing UNC due to past tensions with Patriots' owner Robert Kraft.
Belichick's coaching debut at UNC started with a 48-14 loss to TCU, the worst defensive performance of his career.
